title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 23
author: Various
snippet: You have only to bend your arm, and suppose your shoulder torepresent Edrington Castle, your hand Clarabad, and near the elbow youwill have the spot where "ten cam' rowing owre the water;" a littlenearer to Clarabad is the "lang dyke side," and immediately at the footof it is the site of Tibby's cottage, which stood upon the Edringtonside of the river; and a little to the west of the cottage, you willfind a shadowy row of palm-trees, planted, as tradition testifieth, bythe hands of Tibby's father, old Ned Fowler, of whom many speak untilthis day.
